whatIs.question: What is Plusplus?
whatIs.answer: Plusplus AG is a Swiss fintech company based in Zug that bridges traditional finance with decentralized finance (DeFi). We make DeFi accessible to everyone by simplifying complex blockchain technology while maintaining Swiss standards for security, transparency, and regulatory compliance. Our mission is to unlock the benefits of DeFi—such as efficiency, transparency, and innovation—without requiring technical expertise from our users.

products.question: What services and products does Plusplus offer?
products.answer: We offer DeFi-powered financial products that combine the innovation of blockchain technology with the stability of traditional assets. Currently, this includes WBTC (Bitcoin-based) and ZCHF (Swiss Franc stablecoin) solutions for rental deposits and yield generation. Our product suite is designed to expand over time, offering more ways to access DeFi benefits through user-friendly, regulated services.

howItWorks.question: How does Plusplus work?
howItWorks.answer: Plusplus acts as a bridge between you and the DeFi ecosystem. When you deposit funds, we handle the technical complexity of blockchain interactions, smart contract management, and protocol optimization on your behalf. Your assets are converted into appropriate digital formats (like WBTC or ZCHF) and deployed across vetted DeFi protocols to generate returns. You maintain access to your funds while we manage the technical infrastructure.

benefits.question: What are the benefits of using Plusplus?
benefits.answer: DeFi offers several advantages over traditional finance: greater efficiency through automated smart contracts, complete transparency of operations, potential for higher returns, and 24/7 global accessibility. Plusplus makes these benefits accessible without requiring technical knowledge. You get DeFi innovation with Swiss regulatory oversight, professional risk management, institutional-grade security, and user-friendly interfaces that feel familiar to traditional banking.

security.question: How are my funds secured?
security.answer: Security is our top priority. We implement multiple layers of protection: regulated Swiss custody solutions, thoroughly audited smart contracts, multi-signature wallet controls, and comprehensive insurance coverage. Our technical infrastructure undergoes regular security assessments, and we maintain strict operational procedures. All DeFi protocols we use are carefully vetted for security and reliability.

risks.question: What are the risks of using Plusplus?
risks.answer: Like all financial products, DeFi carries inherent risks that we transparently communicate: smart contract vulnerabilities, market volatility affecting asset values, potential temporary illiquidity in underlying protocols, regulatory changes affecting DeFi operations, and technology risks such as network congestion. We actively manage these risks through diversification, continuous monitoring, insurance coverage, and working only with established, audited protocols. Detailed risk disclosures are provided for each product.

access.question: How can I access my funds? Are there restrictions?
access.answer: Fund accessibility depends on the specific product and underlying DeFi protocols. Generally, we strive to provide flexible access to your investments. Some products may have optimal withdrawal windows to maximize efficiency, while others offer near-instant access. Any restrictions or optimal timing are clearly communicated upfront. Emergency access procedures are available when needed, though they may involve additional costs to ensure rapid processing.

regulation.question: Is Plusplus regulated?
regulation.answer: Yes, Plusplus AG operates under Swiss financial regulations and maintains full compliance with applicable laws. We are registered in Zug, Switzerland, and follow guidelines for digital asset services. We implement know-your-customer (KYC) and anti-money laundering (AML) procedures.

privacy.question: How is my privacy protected?
privacy.answer: We are committed to protecting your privacy under Swiss data protection laws and GDPR. Personal data is collected only when necessary for service provision and regulatory compliance. We use secure, encrypted systems for data storage and transmission. Data is never sold to third parties and is only shared with regulated partners as required for service delivery. You maintain full control over your personal information and can request access, correction, or deletion at any time.

support.question: How do I get started or get support?
support.answer: Getting started is easy! For tenants: Contact your landlord and ask them to initiate the process with Zinsli to use our WBTC and ZCHF-based deposit products for your rental deposit. For landlords: Reach out to Zinsli directly to offer these innovative deposit solutions to your tenants. Need assistance connecting with Zinsli or have questions? Our Swiss-based team is here to help. Contact us at hello@plusplus.swiss or through our website contact form.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This Privacy Policy explains the nature, scope, and purpose of processing personal data on www.plusplus.swiss (the "Website"). For definitions such as "personal data" and "processing," please refer to Article 4 of the GDPR and Article 3 of the Swiss Federal Data Protection Act (nFADP).

section2.title: 2. Collection and Processing of Personal Data

subsection1.title: 2.1. Access Data / Server Log Files
subsection1.content: When you visit the Website, certain data is automatically transmitted by your browser to our hosting provider, Vercel. This includes your IP address, date and time of access, and the URL requested. These data are technically necessary to operate the Website (Art. 45c TCA, Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR).

subsection2.title: 2.2. Contact Form
subsection2.content: If you use our contact form, we collect your name, email address, and the message content you submit. Processing is based on our legitimate interest in responding to inquiries (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR) and, if required, on your explicit consent (Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR).

subsection3.title: 2.3. Cookies and Tracking
subsection3.content1: The Website uses the following cookies and trackers:

list.item1: Necessary cookies for basic site functionality (no consent required).
list.item2: Preference, Statistics, and Marketing cookies only after you have given explicit consent via the cookie banner.

subsection3.content2: Upon consent, we store a cookie named cookieConsent to record your choice. You may withdraw or modify your consent at any time via the cookie banner.

subsection4.title: 2.4. Web Analytics
subsection4.content: We use Simple Analytics (EU-hosted, no cookies) or—only after consent—Google Analytics 4 with Consent Mode v2. Data are collected in anonymized form and not linked to any other Google services.

subsection5.title: 2.5. Third-Party Services
subsection5.content1:
– reCAPTCHA by Google (operating under the EU-US Data Privacy Framework)
– Vercel Analytics (GDPR-compliant)
subsection5.content2: Data are processed only on a lawful basis or after consent and are not transferred to countries without adequate data protection safeguards.

list.item1: Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR / TCA § 45c: Storage of access data to ensure technical operation
list.item2: Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR: Legitimate interest in customer communication
list.item3: Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR: Consent for non-essential cookies and tracking

section4.title: 4. International Data Transfers
section4.content: Personal data are transferred only to countries with an adequate level of protection (Switzerland, EU, UK, Canada, U.S. companies under the EU-US Data Privacy Framework). For transfers to other countries, we use Standard Contractual Clauses.

section5.title: 5. Data Retention
section5.content: We retain personal data only as long as necessary for the purposes stated or as required by law.

section6.title: 6. Your Rights
section6.content: Under Articles 15–20 GDPR, you have the right to access, rectify, erase, restrict processing, and data portability. To exercise these rights, contact us at hello@plusplus.swiss.

section7.title: 7. Updates to This Policy
section7.content: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. The date of the latest revision appears below.
